content:
ActivityDesignerTheme Class

In this Article

Provides the look and feel property settings to a designer in a design-time environment.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated.  Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")]
public class ActivityDesignerTheme : System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerTheme

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerTheme
  • ActivityDesignerTheme

Inherited Members

,
Equals(Object,Object)

Remarks

Note

This material discusses types and namespaces that are obsolete. For more information, see Deprecated Types in Windows Workflow Foundation 4.5.

Designer themes define the look and feel of a designer. This includes any background styles, foreground styles, fonts, and icons defined for the designer.

You can create a custom designer theme if you want to provide configuration abilities to properties unique to your designer. If you do not specify a designer theme for a custom designer, the theme from the base class is used.

Constructors summary

ActivityDesignerTheme(WorkflowTheme)

Initializes an instance of an ActivityDesignerTheme.

Properties summary

BackColorEnd

Gets or sets the Color to end with when using a color gradient for the background color.
BackColorStart

Gets or sets the starting color of the background when using a color gradient on the background.
BackgroundStyle

Gets or sets the background style.
BoldFont

Gets the font for the theme.
BorderColor

Gets or sets the BorderColor for the theme.
BorderPen

Gets the BorderPen for the theme.
BorderStyle

Gets or sets the style used for the border.
BorderWidth

Gets the width of the border in pixels.
DesignerGeometry

Gets the geometry of the designer.
DesignerImage

Gets the image associated with the designer.
DesignerImagePath

Gets or sets the image path for the designer.
Font

Gets the font of the text used by the theme.
ForeColor

Gets or sets the color of the foreground.
ForegroundBrush

Gets the Brush object associated with the theme.
ForegroundPen

Gets the Pen used for painting the foreground of the theme.
ImageSize

Gets the size of the image of the theme.
Size

Gets the size of the designer.

Methods summary

Dispose(Boolean)

Releases the unmanaged resources and optionally releases the managed resources used by ActivityDesignerTheme.
GetBackgroundBrush(Rectangle)

Gets a brush used to paint the area specified by the rectangle passed.
Initialize()

Initializes the designer theme.
OnAmbientPropertyChanged(AmbientProperty)

Called to signal changes to ambient settings.

Constructors

  • ActivityDesignerTheme(WorkflowTheme)

    Initializes an instance of an ActivityDesignerTheme.

    public ActivityDesignerTheme (System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowTheme theme);

    Parameters

    • theme
      WorkflowTheme

      A WorkflowTheme that contains the theme information for the ActivityDesigner.

Properties

  • BackColorEnd

    Gets or sets the Color to end with when using a color gradient for the background color.

    public virtual System.Drawing.Color BackColorEnd { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Color

      The background ending Color.

    Remarks

    BackColorEnd indicates the ending color of a background gradient. To use background gradient color, set the BackColorStart and BackColorEnd properties. The background will gradually change color from the starting color to the ending color.

    Example

    The following example shows how to create a custom ActivityDesignerTheme by deriving from the ActivityDesignerTheme class and setting the appropriate properties for the new theme. 

    public class CustomActivityDesignerTheme : ActivityDesignerTheme
{
    public CustomActivityDesignerTheme(WorkflowTheme theme)
        : base(theme)
    {
        base.Initialize();
        this.BorderStyle = DashStyle.Solid;
        this.BorderColor = Color.FromArgb(0, 0, 0);
        this.BackColorStart = Color.FromArgb(37, 15, 242);
        this.BackColorEnd = Color.FromArgb(189, 184, 254);
        this.BackgroundStyle = LinearGradientMode.Vertical;
        this.ForeColor = Color.Black;
    }
}

    Public Class CustomActivityDesignerTheme
    Inherits ActivityDesignerTheme
    Public Sub New(ByVal theme As WorkflowTheme)
        MyBase.new(theme)

        MyBase.Initialize()
        Me.BorderStyle = DashStyle.Solid
        Me.BorderColor = Color.FromArgb(0, 0, 0)
        Me.BackColorStart = Color.FromArgb(37, 15, 242)
        Me.BackColorEnd = Color.FromArgb(189, 184, 254)
        Me.BackgroundStyle = LinearGradientMode.Vertical
        Me.ForeColor = Color.Black
    End Sub
End Class

    To use the theme on an ActivityDesigner, apply the ActivityDesignerThemeAttribute to the ActivityDesigner class. 

    [ActivityDesignerTheme(typeof(CustomActivityDesignerTheme))]
public class CustomActivityDesigner2 : ActivityDesigner

    <ActivityDesignerTheme(GetType(CustomActivityDesignerTheme))> _
Public Class CustomActivityDesigner2
    Inherits ActivityDesigner
  • BackColorStart

    Gets or sets the starting color of the background when using a color gradient on the background.

    public virtual System.Drawing.Color BackColorStart { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Color

      The background starting Color.

    Remarks

    BackColorStart indicates the background color, or the beginning color of a background gradient. To use background gradient color, set the BackColorStart and BackColorEnd properties. The background will gradually change color from the start color to the end color.

    Example

    The following example shows how to create a custom ActivityDesignerTheme by deriving from the ActivityDesignerTheme class and setting the appropriate properties for the new theme. 

    public class CustomActivityDesignerTheme : ActivityDesignerTheme
{
    public CustomActivityDesignerTheme(WorkflowTheme theme)
        : base(theme)
    {
        base.Initialize();
        this.BorderStyle = DashStyle.Solid;
        this.BorderColor = Color.FromArgb(0, 0, 0);
        this.BackColorStart = Color.FromArgb(37, 15, 242);
        this.BackColorEnd = Color.FromArgb(189, 184, 254);
        this.BackgroundStyle = LinearGradientMode.Vertical;
        this.ForeColor = Color.Black;
    }
}

    Public Class CustomActivityDesignerTheme
    Inherits ActivityDesignerTheme
    Public Sub New(ByVal theme As WorkflowTheme)
        MyBase.new(theme)

        MyBase.Initialize()
        Me.BorderStyle = DashStyle.Solid
        Me.BorderColor = Color.FromArgb(0, 0, 0)
        Me.BackColorStart = Color.FromArgb(37, 15, 242)
        Me.BackColorEnd = Color.FromArgb(189, 184, 254)
        Me.BackgroundStyle = LinearGradientMode.Vertical
        Me.ForeColor = Color.Black
    End Sub
End Class

    To use the theme on an ActivityDesigner, apply the ActivityDesignerThemeAttribute to the ActivityDesigner class. 

    [ActivityDesignerTheme(typeof(CustomActivityDesignerTheme))]
public class CustomActivityDesigner2 : ActivityDesigner

    <ActivityDesignerTheme(GetType(CustomActivityDesignerTheme))> _
Public Class CustomActivityDesigner2
    Inherits ActivityDesigner
  • BackgroundStyle

    Gets or sets the background style.

    public virtual System.Drawing.Drawing2D.LinearGradientMode BackgroundStyle { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • LinearGradientMode

      A LinearGradientMode that describes the background style.

    Remarks

    Use BackgroundStyle to get or set how the background displays color. The BackgroundStyle can be set to one of four modes:

    BackwardDiagonal
    Specifies a gradient from upper right to lower left.

    ForwardDiagonal
    Specifies a gradient from upper left to lower right.

    Horizontal
    Specifies a gradient from left to right.

    Vertical
    Specifies a gradient from top to bottom.

    Example

    The following example shows how to create a custom ActivityDesignerTheme by deriving from the ActivityDesignerTheme class and setting the appropriate properties for the new theme. 

    public class CustomActivityDesignerTheme : ActivityDesignerTheme
{
    public CustomActivityDesignerTheme(WorkflowTheme theme)
        : base(theme)
    {
        base.Initialize();
        this.BorderStyle = DashStyle.Solid;
        this.BorderColor = Color.FromArgb(0, 0, 0);
        this.BackColorStart = Color.FromArgb(37, 15, 242);
        this.BackColorEnd = Color.FromArgb(189, 184, 254);
        this.BackgroundStyle = LinearGradientMode.Vertical;
        this.ForeColor = Color.Black;
    }
}

    Public Class CustomActivityDesignerTheme
    Inherits ActivityDesignerTheme
    Public Sub New(ByVal theme As WorkflowTheme)
        MyBase.new(theme)

        MyBase.Initialize()
        Me.BorderStyle = DashStyle.Solid
        Me.BorderColor = Color.FromArgb(0, 0, 0)
        Me.BackColorStart = Color.FromArgb(37, 15, 242)
        Me.BackColorEnd = Color.FromArgb(189, 184, 254)
        Me.BackgroundStyle = LinearGradientMode.Vertical
        Me.ForeColor = Color.Black
    End Sub
End Class

    To use the theme on an ActivityDesigner, apply the ActivityDesignerThemeAttribute to the ActivityDesigner class. 

    [ActivityDesignerTheme(typeof(CustomActivityDesignerTheme))]
public class CustomActivityDesigner2 : ActivityDesigner

    <ActivityDesignerTheme(GetType(CustomActivityDesignerTheme))> _
Public Class CustomActivityDesigner2
    Inherits ActivityDesigner
  • BoldFont

    Gets the font for the theme.

    public System.Drawing.Font BoldFont { get; }

    Property Value

    • Font

      The Font of the theme.

    Remarks

    BoldFont represents the font to use for highlighted text for the theme.

  • BorderColor

    Gets or sets the BorderColor for the theme.

    public virtual System.Drawing.Color BorderColor { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Color

      A Color that represents the BorderColor of the theme.

    Remarks

    The BorderColor is the color used to draw borders for shapes.

    Example

    The following example shows how to create a custom ActivityDesignerTheme by deriving from the ActivityDesignerTheme class and setting the appropriate properties for the new theme. 

    public class CustomActivityDesignerTheme : ActivityDesignerTheme
{
    public CustomActivityDesignerTheme(WorkflowTheme theme)
        : base(theme)
    {
        base.Initialize();
        this.BorderStyle = DashStyle.Solid;
        this.BorderColor = Color.FromArgb(0, 0, 0);
        this.BackColorStart = Color.FromArgb(37, 15, 242);
        this.BackColorEnd = Color.FromArgb(189, 184, 254);
        this.BackgroundStyle = LinearGradientMode.Vertical;
        this.ForeColor = Color.Black;
    }
}

    Public Class CustomActivityDesignerTheme
    Inherits ActivityDesignerTheme
    Public Sub New(ByVal theme As WorkflowTheme)
        MyBase.new(theme)

        MyBase.Initialize()
        Me.BorderStyle = DashStyle.Solid
        Me.BorderColor = Color.FromArgb(0, 0, 0)
        Me.BackColorStart = Color.FromArgb(37, 15, 242)
        Me.BackColorEnd = Color.FromArgb(189, 184, 254)
        Me.BackgroundStyle = LinearGradientMode.Vertical
        Me.ForeColor = Color.Black
    End Sub
End Class

    To use the theme on an ActivityDesigner, apply the ActivityDesignerThemeAttribute to the ActivityDesigner class. 

    [ActivityDesignerTheme(typeof(CustomActivityDesignerTheme))]
public class CustomActivityDesigner2 : ActivityDesigner

    <ActivityDesignerTheme(GetType(CustomActivityDesignerTheme))> _
Public Class CustomActivityDesigner2
    Inherits ActivityDesigner
  • BorderPen

    Gets the BorderPen for the theme.

    public System.Drawing.Pen BorderPen { get; }

    Property Value

    • Pen

      A Pen that represents the BorderPen of the theme.

    Remarks

    The BorderPen is the pen used to draw borders for shapes.

  • BorderStyle

    Gets or sets the style used for the border.

    public virtual System.Drawing.Drawing2D.DashStyle BorderStyle { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • DashStyle

      A DashStyle enumeration that represents the style used for the border.

    Remarks

    The BorderStyle is the style of line to draw for borders of shapes.

    Example

    The following example shows how to create a custom ActivityDesignerTheme by deriving from the ActivityDesignerTheme class and setting the appropriate properties for the new theme. 

    public class CustomActivityDesignerTheme : ActivityDesignerTheme
{
    public CustomActivityDesignerTheme(WorkflowTheme theme)
        : base(theme)
    {
        base.Initialize();
        this.BorderStyle = DashStyle.Solid;
        this.BorderColor = Color.FromArgb(0, 0, 0);
        this.BackColorStart = Color.FromArgb(37, 15, 242);
        this.BackColorEnd = Color.FromArgb(189, 184, 254);
        this.BackgroundStyle = LinearGradientMode.Vertical;
        this.ForeColor = Color.Black;
    }
}

    Public Class CustomActivityDesignerTheme
    Inherits ActivityDesignerTheme
    Public Sub New(ByVal theme As WorkflowTheme)
        MyBase.new(theme)

        MyBase.Initialize()
        Me.BorderStyle = DashStyle.Solid
        Me.BorderColor = Color.FromArgb(0, 0, 0)
        Me.BackColorStart = Color.FromArgb(37, 15, 242)
        Me.BackColorEnd = Color.FromArgb(189, 184, 254)
        Me.BackgroundStyle = LinearGradientMode.Vertical
        Me.ForeColor = Color.Black
    End Sub
End Class

    To use the theme on an ActivityDesigner, apply the ActivityDesignerThemeAttribute to the ActivityDesigner class. 

    [ActivityDesignerTheme(typeof(CustomActivityDesignerTheme))]
public class CustomActivityDesigner2 : ActivityDesigner

    <ActivityDesignerTheme(GetType(CustomActivityDesignerTheme))> _
Public Class CustomActivityDesigner2
    Inherits ActivityDesigner
  • BorderWidth

    Gets the width of the border in pixels.

    public int BorderWidth { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The width of the border in pixels.

    Remarks

    The BorderWidth is the width in pixels for borders of shapes.

  • DesignerGeometry

    Gets the geometry of the designer.

    public System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerGeometry DesignerGeometry { get; }

    Property Value

    • DesignerGeometry

      An enumeration that describes the geometry of the designer.

    Remarks

    DesignerGeometry represents the default geometry of shapes for the theme.

    Rectangle
    Draws shapes with squared corners.

    RoundedRectangle
    Draws shapes with rounded corners.

  • DesignerImage

    Gets the image associated with the designer.

    public System.Drawing.Image DesignerImage { get; }

    Property Value

    • Image

      The Image to display for the designer.

    Remarks

    The DesignerImage is the default image to display for the designer.

  • DesignerImagePath

    Gets or sets the image path for the designer.

    public virtual string DesignerImagePath { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The image path for the designer.

    Remarks

    The DesignerImagePath is the path to the image file to use as the default image to display for the designer.

  • Font

    Gets the font of the text used by the theme.

    public System.Drawing.Font Font { get; }

    Property Value

    • Font

      The font of the designer theme.

    Remarks

    Font is used to display text in the designer. The Font property determines the font to use for regular text displayed in the designer.

  • ForeColor

    Gets or sets the color of the foreground.

    public virtual System.Drawing.Color ForeColor { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Color

      A Color that represents the foreground color of the theme.

    Remarks

    Use the ForeColor property to specify the foreground color of the theme. The foreground color is usually the color of the text.

    Example

    The following example shows how to create a custom ActivityDesignerTheme by deriving from the ActivityDesignerTheme class and setting the appropriate properties for the new theme. 

    public class CustomActivityDesignerTheme : ActivityDesignerTheme
{
    public CustomActivityDesignerTheme(WorkflowTheme theme)
        : base(theme)
    {
        base.Initialize();
        this.BorderStyle = DashStyle.Solid;
        this.BorderColor = Color.FromArgb(0, 0, 0);
        this.BackColorStart = Color.FromArgb(37, 15, 242);
        this.BackColorEnd = Color.FromArgb(189, 184, 254);
        this.BackgroundStyle = LinearGradientMode.Vertical;
        this.ForeColor = Color.Black;
    }
}

    Public Class CustomActivityDesignerTheme
    Inherits ActivityDesignerTheme
    Public Sub New(ByVal theme As WorkflowTheme)
        MyBase.new(theme)

        MyBase.Initialize()
        Me.BorderStyle = DashStyle.Solid
        Me.BorderColor = Color.FromArgb(0, 0, 0)
        Me.BackColorStart = Color.FromArgb(37, 15, 242)
        Me.BackColorEnd = Color.FromArgb(189, 184, 254)
        Me.BackgroundStyle = LinearGradientMode.Vertical
        Me.ForeColor = Color.Black
    End Sub
End Class

    To use the theme on an ActivityDesigner, apply the ActivityDesignerThemeAttribute to the ActivityDesigner class. 

    [ActivityDesignerTheme(typeof(CustomActivityDesignerTheme))]
public class CustomActivityDesigner2 : ActivityDesigner

    <ActivityDesignerTheme(GetType(CustomActivityDesignerTheme))> _
Public Class CustomActivityDesigner2
    Inherits ActivityDesigner
  • ForegroundBrush

    Gets the Brush object associated with the theme.

    public System.Drawing.Brush ForegroundBrush { get; }

    Property Value

    • Brush

      A Brush object associated with the theme.

    Remarks

    Assigning this property causes the brush associated with the theme to draw filled lines and curves.

  • ForegroundPen

    Gets the Pen used for painting the foreground of the theme.

    public System.Drawing.Pen ForegroundPen { get; }

    Property Value

    • Pen

      A Pen that is used to paint the foreground of the theme.

    Remarks

    The Pen is used to draw a line of a specified width and style. The line drawn by a Pen object can be filled in a variety of fill styles, including solid colors and textures. The fill style depends on which brush or texture used as the fill object.

  • ImageSize

    Gets the size of the image of the theme.

    public System.Drawing.Size ImageSize { get; }

    Property Value

    • Size

      A Size that represents the size of the image.

    Remarks

    The ImageSize is the Size of the default image used by the theme for the designer.

  • Size

    Gets the size of the designer.

    public System.Drawing.Size Size { get; }

    Property Value

    • Size

      A Size that represents the size of the designer.

    Remarks

    The size property represents the Size of the designer.

Methods

  • Dispose(Boolean)

    Releases the unmanaged resources and optionally releases the managed resources used by ActivityDesignerTheme.

    protected override void Dispose (bool disposing);

    Parameters

    • disposing
      Boolean

      true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

    Remarks

    When disposing is true, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that ActivityDesignerTheme references. This method invokes the Dispose method of each referenced object.

  • GetBackgroundBrush(Rectangle)

    Gets a brush used to paint the area specified by the rectangle passed.

    public System.Drawing.Brush GetBackgroundBrush (System.Drawing.Rectangle rectangle);

    Parameters

    • rectangle
      Rectangle

      A Rectangle that specifies the location and size of the area on the background.

    Returns

    • Brush

      A Brush that is used to fill interiors of graphical shapes such as rectangles, ellipses, pies, polygons, and paths.

    Remarks

    The background brush is used to fill the interior of the background of the designer.

  • Initialize()

    Initializes the designer theme.

    public override void Initialize ();

    Remarks

    Initializes the ActivityDesignerTheme with the ambient theme.

  • OnAmbientPropertyChanged(AmbientProperty)

    Called to signal changes to ambient settings.

    public override void OnAmbientPropertyChanged (System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientProperty ambientProperty);

    Parameters

    • ambientProperty
      AmbientProperty

      The property that has changed.

    Remarks

    OnAmbientPropertyChanged is used to notify the theme to apply changes to ambient properties.
